title: Boy injured in Jersey City shooting, sources say
content:
UPDATE: 14-year-old in critical condition
JERSEY CITY -- A teen was seriously injured in a shooting on Ocean Avenue Tuesday night, sources say.
The shooting was reported near Wilkinson Avenues sometime around 7:30 p.m. Multiple sources have said the victim is a 14-year-old boy who was shot in the abdomen area.
He was brought to Jersey City Medical Center for treatment.
A spokesman for the Hudson County Prosecutor's Office said Jersey City is handling the investigation. Jersey City spokeswoman Jennifer Morrill could not immediately be reached for comment.
A man crashed his car into a utility pole on Grand Street Monday morning after someone shot at his vehicle, officials said.
Photos taken by Jersey Journal freelance photographer Joe Shine show at least three evidence markers in the intersection.
The shooting is at least the third in Jersey City this week.
A man crashed his car into a utility pole on Grand Street Monday morning after someone opened fire on his black Acura. Then early Tuesday morning, a 30-year-old man was shot in the ankle near Bergen and Lexington avenues.
